prcitem.title: General
prcitem.para: The Component Maintenance Manual (CMM), for the Bombardier Aerospace Dash 8 Series 400 Aircraft, is written in general accordance with the Air Transport Association of America Specification No. 100 (ATA-100), Revision 34, dated February 15, 1996.
The CMM gives bench overhaul instructions for those components of the Dash 8 Series 400 Aircraft that are Bombardier Aerospace proprietary parts.

Both the U.S. Standard System and the Systeme International (SI) systems of measurement are used in the CMM. The system used in the initial reference document is given first, followed by the conversion in parentheses.
The Technical Publications department of Bombardier Aerospace will supply Temporary Revision service to the CMM as necessary.

Where the data or procedures specified in this manual are different from those specified by the regulatory agency which controls operation of your aircraft, obey the data and procedures of the regulatory authority.

prcitem.title: CMM Pageblocks
prcitem.para: The data for each component included in the CMM is divided into specified pageblocks as necessary, each pageblock having its own specified subject matter and page numbering. These pageblocks are titled as follows:

note.para: If more than 99 pages are necessary in a pageblock, the page numbers will stop at 98 and continue with 98.1, 98.2, 98.3 and so on.

prcitem.title: Correspondence
prcitem.para: Send all correspondence about this manual to:
Bombardier Aerospace
Customer Support
Mailbox Stop N42-25
123 Garrett Blvd., Downsview
Ontario Canada
M3K 1Y5
Attention: Manager, Dash 8 Series 400 Technical Publications.

pretopic.title: General
pretopic.para: The DC Control Panel Assembly has Bombardier Aerospace part number 82410603-009. The panel assembly is installed in the overhead console in the flight compartment of the aircraft.

prcitem.para: The DC Control Panel Assembly contains nine toggle switches. The individual selections of these switches are as follows:
The DC Control Panel Assembly also includes the items that follow:

unlitem.para: three connectors (two for the panel and one for the integral lighting)

prcitem.para: STBY BATT Switch
When the STBY BATT switch is selected from the OFF position to the STBY BATT position, the standby battery is connected to the left main feeder bus through contactor K25.
AUX BATT Switch
When the AUX BATT switch is selected from the OFF position to the AUX BATT position, the auxiliary battery is connected to the left main feeder bus through contactor K7.
MAIN BATT Switch
When the MAIN BATT switch is selected from the OFF position to the MAIN BATT position, the main battery is connected to the right main feeder bus through contactor K8.
BATTERY MASTER Switch
When the BATTERY MASTER switch is selected from the OFF position to the BATTERY MASTER position, the three batteries are connected to the essential busses of the aircraft.
GEN 1 Switch

With the aircraft engines operating with no external DC power connected, selecting the GEN 1 switch from the OFF position to the GEN 1 position allows the DC generator installed on the left engine to supply DC electrical power to the related main feeder and essential distribution busses.

pretopic.title: General
pretopic.para: Continuity checks using a multimeter are done to make sure that the operation of the switches and their wiring is correct.
A variable, 5 V dc power supply is used to check the integral lighting of the panel.

l1item.para: Visual Check

l2item.para: Do a Visual Check of the DC Control Panel Assembly (refer to CHECK, pageblock 24-31-16_501).

l1item.para: Operational Check - Integral Lighting of the Panel (refer to Figure 101)

l2item.para: Make sure that the variable 5 V dc power supply is set to OFF and the output voltage is set to 0 Vdc.
On connector J101, put the positive lead of the variable 5 V dc power supply in pin B and put the negative lead in pin C.
Set the power supply to ON and make sure that the integral lighting in the panel is off.
Gradually increase the dc voltage from 0 to 5 V dc and make sure that the integral lighting gradually gets brighter and reaches maximum brightness at 5 V dc.
Set the power supply to OFF.
Remove the positive lead and the negative lead of the 5 V dc power supply from the panel.

l1item.para: Continuity Check - STBY BATT Switch (2431-S9) (refer to Figure 101)

l2item.para: Make sure that the STBY BATT switch (2431-S9) is set to OFF.
On connector J101, put the positive lead of the multimeter in pin P and put the negative lead in pin V.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the STBY BATT switch to STBY BATT and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the STBY BATT switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead and the negative lead of the multimeter from the connector.

l1item.para: Continuity Check - AUX BATT Switch (2431-S3) (refer to Figure 101)

l2item.para: Make sure that the AUX BATT Switch (2431-S3) is set to OFF.
On connector J101, put the positive lead of the multimeter in pin y and put the negative lead of the multimeter in pin AA.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the AUX BATT switch to AUX BATT and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the AUX BATT switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead of the multimeter from pin y and put the lead in pin z.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the AUX BATT switch to AUX BATT and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the AUX BATT switch to OFF.
Remove the negative lead of the multimeter from pin AA and put the lead in pin JJ.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the AUX BATT switch to AUX BATT and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the AUX BATT switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead of the multimeter from pin z and put the lead in pin M.
Remove the negative lead of the multimeter from pin JJ and put the lead in pin D.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the AUX BATT switch to AUX BATT and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the AUX BATT switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead and the negative lead of the multimeter from the connector.

l1item.para: Continuity Check - MAIN BATT Switch (2431-S4) (refer to Figure 101)

l2item.para: Make sure that the MAIN BATT Switch (2431-S4) is set to OFF.
On connector J101, put the positive lead of the multimeter in pin R and on connector J100, put the negative lead of the multimeter in pin C.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the MAIN BATT switch to MAIN BATT and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the MAIN BATT switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead of the multimeter from pin R and put the lead in pin DD on connector J101.
Remove the negative lead of the multimeter from pin C on connector J100, and put the lead in pin FF on connector J101.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the MAIN BATT switch MAIN BATT and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the MAIN BATT switch to OFF.
Remove the negative lead of the multimeter from pin FF on connector J101 and put the lead in pin LL.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the MAIN BATT switch MAIN BATT and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the MAIN BATT switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead of the multimeter from pin DD on connector J101 and put the lead in pin EE.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the MAIN BATT switch MAIN BATT and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the MAIN BATT switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead and the negative lead of the multimeter from the connector.

l1item.para: Continuity Check - BATTERY MASTER Switch (2431-S7) (refer to Figure 101)

l2item.para: Make sure that the BATTERY MASTER switch is set to OFF.
On connector J101, put the positive lead of the multimeter in pin K and on connector J100, put the negative lead of the multimeter in pin D.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the BATTERY MASTER switch to BATTERY MASTER and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the BATTERY MASTER switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead of the multimeter from pin K and put the lead in pin F on connector J101.
Remove the negative lead of the multimeter from pin D on connector J100, and put the lead in pin H on connector J100.
Make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Remove the negative lead of the multimeter from pin H on connector J100, and put the lead in pin E on connector J100.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the BATTERY MASTER switch to BATTERY MASTER and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the BATTERY MASTER switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead and the negative lead of the multimeter from the connectors.
On connector J100, put the positive lead of the multimeter in pin B and put the negative lead of the multimeter in pin G.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the BATTERY MASTER switch to BATTERY MASTER and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the BATTERY MASTER switch to OFF.
On connector J100, put the positive lead of the multimeter in pin F and put the negative lead of the multimeter in pin A.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the BATTERY MASTER switch to BATTERY MASTER and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the BATTERY MASTER switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead and the negative lead of the multimeter from the connector.

l1item.para: Continuity Check - GEN 1 Switch (2431-S1) (refer to Figure 101)

l2item.para: Make sure that the GEN 1 switch (2431-S1) is set to OFF.
On connector J100, put the positive lead of the multimeter in pin K and put the negative lead in pin L.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the GEN 1 switch to GEN 1 and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the GEN 1 switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead of the multimeter from pin K and put the lead in pin N.
Remove the negative lead of the multimeter from pin L and put the lead in pin M.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the GEN 1 switch to GEN 1 and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Remove the positive lead of the multimeter from pin N and put the lead in pin J.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the GEN 1 switch to OFF and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Remove the positive lead and the negative lead of the multimeter from the connector.

l1item.para: Continuity Check - GEN 2 Switch (2431-S2) (refer to Figure 101)

l2item.para: Make sure that the GEN 2 switch (2431-S2) is set to OFF.
On connector J100, put the positive lead of the multimeter in pin R and put the negative lead in pin V.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the GEN 2 switch to GEN 2 and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the GEN 2 switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead of the multimeter from pin R and put the lead in pin T.
Remove the negative lead of the multimeter from pin V and put the lead in pin U.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the GEN 2 switch to GEN 2 and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Remove the positive lead of the multimeter from pin T and put the lead in pin S.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the GEN 2 switch to OFF and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Remove the positive lead and the negative lead of the multimeter from the connector.

l1item.para: Continuity Check - MAIN BUS TIE Switch (2431-S5) (refer to Figure 101)

l2item.para: Make sure that the MAIN BUS TIE switch (2431-S5) is set to OFF.
On connector J101, put the positive lead of the multimeter in pin U and put the negative lead of the multimeter in pin W.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the MAIN BUS TIE switch to MAIN BUS TIE and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the MAIN BUS TIE switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead and the negative lead of the multimeter from the connector

l1item.para: Continuity Check - BUS FAULT RESET Switch (2431-S6) (refer to Figure 101)

l2item.para: Make sure that the BUS FAULT RESET switch (2431-S6) is set to OFF.
On connector J101, put the positive lead of the multimeter in pin A and put the negative lead in pin X.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the BUS FAULT RESET switch to BUS FAULT RESET and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the BUS FAULT RESET switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead and the negative lead of the multimeter from the connector.

l1item.para: Continuity Check - EXT PWR Switch (2431-S8) (refer to Figure 101)

l2item.para: Make sure that the EXT PWR Switch (2431-S8) is set to OFF.
On connector J101, put the positive lead of the multimeter in pin T and put the negative lead in pin H.
Make sure that the multimeter shows an open circuit.
Set the EXT PWR switch to EXT PWR and make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Set the EXT PWR switch to OFF.
Remove the positive lead and the negative lead of the multimeter from the connector.

l1item.para: Continuity Check - Panel Ground (refer to Figure 101)

l2item.para: On connector J100, put the positive lead of the multimeter in pin P and put the negative lead of the multimeter on a bare, metallic, un-painted part of the panel chassis.
Make sure that the multimeter shows continuity.
Remove the positive lead of the multimeter from the connector and remove the negative lead of the multimeter from the panel chassis.

l1item.para: Close-out

l2item.para: Refer to ASSEMBLY, pageblock 24-31-16_701 and continue with the assembly procedures to complete the build of the panel. These final procedures are listed in this pageblock for reference only and are as follows:

l3item.para: torque the jamnuts.
safety the jamnuts with lockwire.
visually inspect for cleanliness.
install the cover.
put protective wrapping on the panel.

graphic.title: DC Control Panel Assembly - Wiring Diagram

pretopic.title: General
pretopic.para: Examine the DC Control Panel Assembly. Refer to Testing and Fault Isolation, pageblock 24-31-16_101 to help find the cause of the defect or malfunction. Disassemble the panel as much as will be necessary to bring the panel to a serviceable condition when reassembling.

l1item.para: DC Control Panel Assembly (refer to Figure 301) (refer to Figure 302)

note.para: The item numbers given in the procedure that follows are the same as those given in the IPL (Illustrated Parts List).

l2item.para: Remove the facing panel (35) by removing the two screws (110).
Remove the three screws (125), the three washers (130) and remove the cover (60).
Remove the lockwire from between the jamnuts on the connectors (180) and (185).
Remove the jamnuts from the connectors (180) and (185).
Remove the four screws (120) from the connector mounting plate (70).
Remove the four screws (120) from the backing panel (10) to the four spacers (115).
Remove the ty-wraps.
Remove the wires from between the switches and the connectors that follow:

l3item.para: two wires between the STBY BATT switch (145) and the connector J101 (185).
four wires between the AUX BATT switch (145) and the connector J101 (185) and the two splices (-210) with the two wires.
three wires between the MAIN BATT switch (145) and the connector J101 (185) and the two splices (-210) with the two wires.
one wire between the MAIN BATT switch (145) and the connector J100 (180).
seven wires between the BATTERY MASTER switch (160) and the connector J100 (180)
two wires between the BATTERY MASTER switch (160) and the connector J100 (185)
five wires between the GEN 1 switch (150) and the connector J100 (180).
five wires between the GEN 2 switch (150) and the connector J100 (180).
two wires between the MAIN BUS TIE switch (155) and the connector J101 (185).
two wires between the BUS FAULT RESET switch (175) and the connector J101 (185).
two wires between the EXT PWR switch (165) and the connector J101 (185).

l2item.para: Remove the locknut (105), the spring washer (95) and the flat washer (90) from the ground stud screw (85).
Remove the wire from between the ground stud screw (85) and the connector J100 (180). Remove the flat washer (90).
Remove the two wires from between the panel lighting connector (45) and the connector (185).
Remove the switches (145), (150), (155), (160), (165) and (175) from the backing panel (10).
Remove the panel lighting connector (45) from the facing panel (35).
Remove the screw (85), the flat washers (90), the spring washer (95) and the nut (100) from the backing panel (10).
Remove the four panel fasteners (25) from the backing panel (10).
Refer to REPAIR, pageblock 24-31-16_601, if necessary to remove and replace the anchor nuts on the backing panel or the connector mounting plate.

l1item.para: Close-out

l2item.para: Protect the serviceable panel components with cushioning material and corrugated paper for premium protection for storage purposes.

graphic.title: DC Control Panel Assembly - Wiring Diagram

pretopic.title: General
pretopic.para: Cleaning the panel may consist of a wash with weak detergent and wiping with a clean cloth. The electrical components must be clean and free of unwanted materials.

General cleaning is used for removing gross soils, for appearance uses, or before a final cleaning operation, when precleaning is specified. General cleaning includes cleaning before applying adhesive-backed labels, ink stamping or after machining.

l1item.para: General Cleaning
All item numbers referenced are the same item numbers as used in the IPL (Illustrated Parts List).

l2item.para: Remove loose soil, dirt or other unwanted material from the facing panel (35) using a soft brush and a hand/dishwashing compound.
Remove loose soil, dirt, metal filings or other unwanted material from the backing panel (10) using a soft cloth and the dry cleaning solvent.
Remove the unwanted dishwashing compound and solvent fully using clean dry cloths.

pretopic.title: General
pretopic.para: The DC Control Panel Assembly has Bombardier Aerospace part number 82410603-009. The panel is installed in the overhead console in the flight compartment of the aircraft.
The check that follows is a visual inspection of the components of the DC Control Panel Assembly.

l1item.para: Visual Check of the components of the DC Control Panel Assembly.

l2item.para: Check all parts for the absence of damage (dents, cracks, distortion, and signs of corrosion).
Check for the absence of cracks, chips or scratches which will allow light leakage in the facing panel (mounting holes excepted).
Check all parts for security of fit.
Check the integrity of the electrical connections.
Check that the parts are clean. Make sure that there is no unwanted matter.
Check that the identification marks are clear and can be read easily.
Check that the facing panel conforms to color (refer to REPAIR, pageblock 24-31-16_601).

pretopic.title: General
pretopic.para: All dimensions and tolerance symbols are written to ANSI Y14.5M, 1982 standards.
The components of the DC Control Panel Assembly are as follows:

unlitem.para: three connectors (two for the panel and one for the integral lighting)

l1item.para: Component Detail Illustrations

l2item.para: The details of the Facing Panel are shown in Figure 601.
The details of the Backing Panel are shown in Figure 602.
The details of the Connector Mounting Plate are shown in Figure 603.
The details of the Spacers are shown in Figure 604.
The details of the Cover Assembly are shown in Figure 605.

l1item.para: Permitted Repairs

l2item.para: Do not repair components that have cracks or corrosion or are damaged.
The permitted repairs are given as follows:

l3item.para: disassembly and assembly; to replace worn or unserviceable components
the application of primers, paints, ink stamps and silkscreens
anodic layer application per MIL-A-8625.

std.stdname: Gerber Advantage, Plotter, Film Stand and Trimmer

con.conname: Tempo Paint & Varnish or Tristar Coatings

con.connbr: Stamp Pad Ink (Black) and Rubber Stamps
con.conname: Laundry Ink 6035-BC, J.M. McLaren orAlcosol, Matthew Int'l.

con.connbr: Screen Printing Ink - Black Vinyl, Gloss Finish and Solvents

note.para: All parts (items) are shown with the same item numbers used in the IPL (Illustrated Parts List).

l1item.para: Facing Panel (refer to Figure 601)

note.para: The material specification for the Facing Panel (35) is Plexiglass, Specification MIL-P-5425, 0.25 inch (6,35 mm) thick. The letters on the panel are in accordance with MIL-M-18012A.

l2item.para: Make sure that the dimensions of the Facing Panel (35) agree to the dimensions shown in Figure 601.

warning.para: HAVE A GOOD FLOW OF CLEAN AIR AND APPROVED BODY PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS. DO NOT GET SOLVENTS ON YOUR BODY OR BREATHE THE FUMES. KEEP FLAMES AND SPARKS AWAY FROM THE AREA. MANY SOLVENTS ARE POISONOUS AND FLAMMABLE.

l2item.para: Make sure that you do not get the solvents on your skin, eyes, ears or in your respiratory tract. Make sure that you use skin and eye protection while handling the dangerous chemicals or solvents.
Clean the Facing Panel (35) (refer to CLEANING, pageblock 24-31-16_401).
If necessary to apply primer and paint, do the steps that follow:

l3item.para: Apply a layer of primer to the Facing Panel (35) and to the heads of the two screws (110).
Let the Facing Panel and the screws air dry for 1 hour at room temperature.
Apply a layer of grey paint to the Facing Panel (35) and to the heads of the two screws (110).
Let the Facing Panel and the screws air dry for 1 to 6 hours at room temperature.

note.para: Room temperature is defined as 61°F to 90°F (16°C to 32°C).

l3item.para: Use an applicable stencil and apply the yellow paint stripes on the Facing Panel. Apply the white paint for the small white cross on the face of the Facing Panel.
Let the paint air dry for 1 to 6 hours at room temperature.
Apply the lusterless white paint for the lines and letters on the Facing Panel. The letters must be centered as shown in Figure 601 and the letter height is as follows:

unlitem.para: All other lettering and lines: .125 in. (3,175 mm).

l2item.para: Let the paint have a cure time of 24 hours at room temperature.
Install new grommets (40) if necessary. Make sure that the grommets agree to the dimensions shown in Figure 601.

l1item.para: Backing Panel (refer to Figure 602)

note.para: The material specification for the Backing Panel (10) is 2024 T3 Alclad Aluminum, Specification QQ-A-250/5. The Backing Panel is 0.063 inch (1,60 mm) thick.

l2item.para: Make sure that the dimensions of the Backing Panel (10) agree to the dimensions shown in Figure 602.
If necessary, make the cutouts and the countersinks in the Backing Panel (10) as shown in Figure 602.
If necessary, remove the four anchor nuts (15) by drilling out the eight rivets (20).

warning.para: HAVE A GOOD FLOW OF CLEAN AIR AND APPROVED BODY PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS. DO NOT GET SOLVENTS ON YOUR BODY OR BREATHE THE FUMES. KEEP FLAMES AND SPARKS AWAY FROM THE AREA. MANY SOLVENTS ARE POISONOUS AND FLAMMABLE.

l2item.para: Make sure that you do not get the solvents on your skin, eyes, ears or in your respiratory tract. Make sure that you use skin and eye protection while handling the dangerous solvents or chemicals.
If necessary, do the steps that follow:

l3item.para: Refer to specification MIL-C-81706 and apply, by the immersion process, the Iridite 14-2 fluid resistant conversion coating to the Backing Panel (10).

note.para: The Iridite 14-2 is a process by Allied Kelite Division, the Richardson Co., Class A Form II, Method C.

l2item.para: Apply the masking tape to the countersink areas. Apply a layer of the dark grey paint to the front face and edges of the Backing Panel.
Let the paint air dry for 1 to 6 hours at room temperature.
Install the four anchor nuts (15) using the eight rivets (20).
Install the panel fasteners (25).
Apply primer and touch-up paint (dark grey) to the panel fasteners as follows:

l3item.para: Apply a layer of primer to the head of each panel fastener.
Let the primer air dry for 1 to 6 hours at room temperature.
Apply a dark grey paint finish to the head of each panel fastener.
Let the paint have a cure time of 24 hours at room temperature.

l1item.para: Connector Mounting Plate (refer to Figure 603)

note.para: The material specification for the Connector Mounting Plate (70) is 2024 T3 Alclad Aluminum, Specification QQ-A-250/5. The Connector Mounting Plate is 0.063 in. (1,60 mm) thick.

l2item.para: Make sure that the dimensions of the Connector Mounting Plate (70) agree to the dimensions shown in Figure 603.
If necessary, make the cutout and the countersinks in the Connector Mounting Plate as shown in Figure 603.
If necessary, remove the three anchor nuts (75) by drilling out the six rivets (80).

warning.para: HAVE A GOOD FLOW OF CLEAN AIR AND APPROVED BODY PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS. DO NOT GET SOLVENTS ON YOUR BODY OR BREATHE THE FUMES. KEEP FLAMES AND SPARKS AWAY FROM THE AREA. MANY SOLVENTS ARE POISONOUS AND FLAMMABLE.

l2item.para: Make sure that you do not get the solvents on your skin, eyes, ears or in your respiratory tract. Make sure that you use skin and eye protection while handling the dangerous chemicals or solvents.
If necessary, do the step that follows:

l3item.para: Refer to specification MIL-C-81706 and apply, by the immersion process, the Iridite 14-2 fluid resistant conversion coating to the Connector Mounting Plate (70).

l2item.para: Install the three anchor nuts (75) using the six rivets (80).

l1item.para: Spacer (refer to Figure 604)

note.para: The material specification for the Spacer (115) is 2024 T-4 Aluminum Alloy, Specification QQ-A-250/6.

l2item.para: Make sure that the dimensions of the Spacers (115) agree to the dimensions shown in Figure 604. The end of each spacer must be tapped to the references indicated.

warning.para: HAVE A GOOD FLOW OF CLEAN AIR AND APPROVED BODY PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS. DO NOT GET SOLVENTS ON YOUR BODY OR BREATHE THE FUMES. KEEP FLAMES AND SPARKS AWAY FROM THE AREA. MANY SOLVENTS ARE POISONOUS AND FLAMMABLE.

l2item.para: Make sure that you do not get the solvents on your skin, eyes, ears or in your respiratory tract. Make sure that you use skin and eye protection while handling the dangerous chemicals or solvents.
If necessary, refer to specification MIL-A-8625 and apply the chromic acid anodizing protective finish to the Spacers.
Protect the tapped ends of the spacers from the application of the primer. Apply a layer of primer to the spacers.
Let the primer air dry for 6 hours at room temperature.

l1item.para: Cover Assembly (refer to Figure 605)

note.para: The material specification for the Cover (60) is polycarbonate sheet material, self-extinguishing and low smoke emission. The polycarbonate sheet material is 0.080 inch (2,03 mm) thick when manufactured by the General Electric Co. The manufacturer's identification is Lexan F-6000. The specification agrees to DHMS (DeHavilland Material Specification) Grade P1.01/3-2C.

l2item.para: Make sure that the dimensions of the Cover (60) agree to the dimensions shown in Figure 605.

note.para: The side walls are 0.020 inch (0,51 mm) in thickness minimum after forming.

l1item.para: Part Identification (Labels, Ink Stamping and Silkscreen)

l2item.para: Clean the Backing Panel and the Connector Mounting Plate (refer to CLEANING, pageblock 24-31-16_401).

caution.para: DO NOT USE LEAD PENCILS, A METAL TAPE, OR PROCEDURES THAT WILL CAUSE A CARBON PARTICLE TRACK OR A SCRATCH. IF YOU DO, THE COMPONENT CAN BECOME DEFECTIVE FROM DISSIMILAR METAL CORROSION.

l2item.para: Use the Gerber equipment to procure the adhesive-backed labels. Put the labels that follow on the rear of the Backing Panel (10):

l3item.para: 3314-DS101 (beside the panel integral lights connector)
2431-GS100 (beside the ground stud screw).

l2item.para: Stamp the black ink identification on the Connector Mounting Plate (70) that follows:

warning.para: HAVE A GOOD FLOW OF CLEAN AIR AND APPROVED BODY PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS. DO NOT GET SOLVENTS ON YOUR BODY OR BREATHE THE FUMES. KEEP FLAMES AND SPARKS AWAY FROM THE AREA. MANY SOLVENTS ARE POISONOUS AND FLAMMABLE.

l2item.para: Make sure that you do not get the solvents on your skin, eyes, ears or in your respiratory tract. Make sure that you use skin and eye protection while handling the dangerous solvents or chemicals.
Use the black screen printing ink and apply the connector identifications 2431-J100 and 2431-J101 on the Cover (60).

l1item.para: Close-out

l2item.para: Protect the components with cushioning material and corrugated paper for premium protection for storage purposes.

pretopic.title: General
pretopic.para: The DC Control Panel Assembly has Bombardier Aerospace part number 82410603-009. The panel assembly is located in the overhead console in the flight compartment of the aircraft.

std.stdnbr: Torque Wrench, capable of 30 lbf/in. (3,39 N·m)
Torque Wrench, capable of 150 lbf/in. (16,95 N·m)
Hot Air Gun (with interchangeable deflector attachments)

con.conname: Raychem Corp p/n 55PC0211 or Judd Wire Inc. p/n JWB0801150
Raychem Corp p/n 55PC0211 or Judd Wire Inc. p/n JWB0801150

note.para: The wire types used in the DC Control Panel Assembly adhere to the following definition: Wire, SPC, Tin-Coated Copper, XLETFE insulated, light airframe, 600 Volt, 150°C; AWG12, AWG16, AWG20 and AWG22, color white.

The assembly instructions for the DC Control Panel Assembly that follow are used after the components have been repaired and cleaned (refer to pageblocks REPAIR, 24-31-16_601 and CLEANING, 24-31-16_401).

l1item.para: DC Control Panel Assembly (refer to Figure 701) (refer to Figure 702)

note.para: All parts (items) are illustrated with the same item numbers used in the IPL (Illustrated Parts List). All wire codes and reference designations are prefixed by the 2431- system code identification.

l2item.para: Assemble the ground stud assembly (2431-GS100) to the backing panel (10) as follows:

l3item.para: install the screw (85), one flat washer (90), a spring washer (95) and the nut (100).
torque the nut (100) to 18 to 20 lbf/in. (2,03 to 2,26 N·m).
strip the ground wire and crimp into the terminal lug (205).
install a flat washer (90), the ground wire terminal lug (205), a flat washer (90), a spring washer (95), and the locknut (105).
torque the locknut (105) to 15 to 17 lbf/in. (1,70 to 1,92 N·m).
put a torque-identification stripe (witness mark) of the white sealant on the ground stud assembly-to-backing panel.

l2item.para: Install the panel integral lights connector (45) to the backing panel (10).
Strip and tin the wires for the BUS FAULT RESET toggle switch (175) and solder the wires to the switch.
Install the switches that follow to the backing panel (10):

l3item.para: the STBY BATT, AUX BATT and the MAIN BATT switches (145).
the BATTERY MASTER switch (160).
the GEN 1 and GEN 2 switches (150).
the MAIN BUS TIE switch (155).
the BUS FAULT RESET switch (175).
the EXT PWR switch (165).

l2item.para: Strip the two wires for the connector (45) and crimp into the two terminal lugs (-200).
Attach the two terminal lugs (-200) to the connector (45).
Strip the wires and crimp the thirty-one terminal lugs (-195) for the 20 and 22 AWG wires.
Attach the thirty-one terminal lugs to the appropriate switches and switch pins.
Strip the wires (12 AWG) for the four terminal lugs (-190).
Cut and loosely install the Kynar insulation (-215) to cover the barrel lugs and to overlap the wire insulation approx. 0.0625 inch (1,60 mm).
Crimp the terminal lugs (-190) and install to the MAIN BATT and AUX BATT switches (145). Bend the terminal lugs as required before heat shrinking the insulation.

warning.para: THE HOT AIR GUN CAN HAVE MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES OF 500°F (260°C) AT THE SCREEN NOZZLE. BE CAREFUL THAT YOU DO NOT BURN YOUR SKIN OR CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT.

l2item.para: Carefully use the hot air gun to heat shrink the insulation sleeves (-215).
Create the four splices (-210).
Install the label (-135) beside the ground stud assembly.
Install the label (-140) beside the panel lights connector (45).

Apply the sealant (loctite) to the threads of the four screws (120) and into the tapped ends of the four spacers (115). Install the four spacers (115) to the backing panel (10) using the four screws (120).
Route the wires to their second ends, providing service loops.
Attach the ty-wraps as applicable.
Cut the wires to length.
Strip and crimp the wires into the contact pins.
Insert the wired contact pins into the applicable connector, (180) or (185).
Insert the sealing plugs into the unused locations on the connectors.

note.para: The contact pins and the sealing plugs are supplied with the connectors.

l2item.para: Install the connectors (180) and (185) on the connector mounting plate (70) using the jamnuts. Do not torque the jamnuts at this time.

note.para: The jamnuts are supplied with the connectors.

l2item.para: Apply the sealant (loctite) to the threads of the four screws (120) and into the tapped ends of the four spacers (115).
Install the connector mounting plate (70), with the connectors (180) and (185), on the spacers (115) using the four screws (120).
Use the red Dalo marker and put a witness mark at each end of the spacers (115).

note.para: The red dot mark at each end of the spacers is applied to show that loctite was used.

l2item.para: Make sure that the four panel fasteners (25) are installed to the backing panel (10).
Make sure that the two grommets (40) and the lamp assemblies (-50) are installed in the facing panel (35).
Make sure that the heads of the four screws (110) have have been primed and painted (refer to REPAIR, pageblock 24-31-16_601).
Install the facing panel (35) to the backing panel (10) using the four screws (110).
Do the continuity and operational checks, refer to TESTING and FAULT ISOLATION, pageblock 24-31-16_101.
Torque the jamnut on the connector (180) to 60 to 65 lbf/in. (6,78 to 7,35 N·m).
Torque the jamnut on the connector (185) to 120 to 125 lbf/in. (13,56 to 14,13 N·m).
Check for cleanliness by visually inspecting the internal assemblies of the panel (before closing with the cover).
Install the cover (60) using the three screws (125), and the three washers (130).
Wirelock the jamnuts on the connectors together.

l1item.para: Close-out

l2item.para: Protect the DC Control Panel Assembly with cushioning material and corrugated paper for premium protection for storage purposes.

graphic.title: DC Control Panel Assembly - Wiring Diagram

pretopic.title: General
pretopic.para: The fits and clearances data for the DC Control Panel Assembly, part number 82410603-009, is not applicable.
Torque values of the items that must be torqued to a specified set of values during the assembly procedures are shown here. The torque values are also given in ASSEMBLY, pageblock 24-31-16_701.

l1item.para: The torque values shown are for specified items of the DC Control Panel Assembly. Each item shown has the same item number as shown in the Illustrated Parts List.

pretopic.title: General
pretopic.para: The DC Control Panel Assembly has Bombardier Aerospace part number 82410603-009.

prcitem.para: The purpose of the Illustrated Parts List is to show each part that makes up the DC Control Panel Assembly and also to identify each part with its part number.
The Detailed Parts List has the column designations that follow:
FIG. ITEM

This column connects the figure and item numbers listed, with the illustration figure and illustration item numbers. A dash (-) before the item number indicates that the item is not shown on the illustration.
PART NUMBER
This column gives the item's part number.
AIRLINE STOCK NO.
This column is reserved for airline use.
NOMENCLATURE

This column puts a name to the item and part number. A “P” following the description indicates that the item is a proprietary, or Bombardier Aerospace manufactured part. A “V” indicates that the item is procured by a Vendor.
EFFECT CODE

This column relates item interchangeability by assigning an alpha code that corresponds to the same alpha code in the higher assembly or sub-assembly. If the column is blank, the item is applicable to all assemblies.
UNITS PER ASSY
This column shows the number of units of the indicated item that are required in the build of one component assembly. “RF” is for reference only.
The following is a list of the Vendors of those items in the detailed parts list that have been identified with a “V”.

nom.adt: (STBY BATT, AUX BATT OR MAIN BATT)
